events.name: plusCollapse
events.description: Fires when the element is about to collapse. This event can be [canceled](TODO).

events.name: plusCollapsed
events.description: Fires after the element has collapsed.

events.name: plusExpand
events.description: Fires when the element is about to expand. This event can be [canceled](TODO).

events.name: plusExpanded
events.description: Fires after the element has expanded.

methods.name: collapse
methods.description: Collapses the element.

tags.value: {Promise<boolean>} A Promise that resolves to `true` if the operation was successful or `false` if it was canceled.

methods.name: expand
methods.description: Expands the element.

tags.value: {Promise<boolean>} A Promise that resolves to `true` if the operation was successful or `false` if it was canceled.

methods.name: toggle
methods.description: Toggles between `collapse` and `expand` state.

tags.value: {Promise<boolean>} A Promise that resolves to `true` if the operation was successful or `false` if it was canceled.

properties.name: open
properties.description: Control the element to expand or not.

properties.name: summary
properties.description: The summary text displayed on the header.

elements.title: Accordion
elements.description: A vertically stacked list of headers that reveal or hide associated sections of content.

properties.name: persistent
properties.description: Specifies that only one accordion can be open.

events.name: plusCancel
events.description: Fires when the [Animation.cancel()](https://mdn.io/animation-cancel) method is called or when the animation enters the "`idle`" play state from another state.

events.name: plusFinish
events.description: Fires when the animation finishes playing.

events.name: plusRemove
events.description: Fires when the animation is removed (i.e., put into an `active` replace state).

methods.name: cancel
methods.description: Clears all [keyframeEffects](https://mdn.io/keyframe-effect) caused by this animation and aborts its playback.

methods.name: commitStyles
methods.description: Commits the end styling state of an animation to the element being animated, even after that animation has been removed. It will cause the end styling state to be written to the element being animated, in the form of properties inside a `style` attribute.

methods.name: finish
methods.description: Seeks either end of an animation, depending on whether the animation is playing or reversing.

methods.name: pause
methods.description: Suspends playing of an animation.

methods.name: persist
methods.description: Explicitly persists an animation, when it would otherwise be removed due to the browser's [Automatically removing filling animations](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Animation#automatically_removing_filling_animations) behavior.

methods.name: play
methods.description: Starts or resumes playing of an animation, or begins the animation again if it previously finished.

methods.name: reverse
methods.description: Reverses playback direction, stopping at the start of the animation. If the animation is finished or unplayed, it will play from end to beginning.

methods.name: updatePlaybackRate
methods.description: Sets the speed of an animation after first synchronizing its playback position.

properties.name: composite
properties.description: Determines how values are combined between this animation and other, separate animations that do not specify their own specific composite operation.

properties.name: delay
properties.description: The number of milliseconds to delay the start of the animation.

properties.name: direction
properties.description: Whether the animation runs forwards (`normal`), backwards (`reverse`), switches direction after each iteration (`alternate`), or runs backwards and switches direction after each iteration (`alternate-reverse`).

properties.name: duration
properties.description: The number of milliseconds each iteration of the animation takes to complete. Keep in mind that your animation will not run if this value is 0.

properties.name: easing
properties.description: The rate of the animation's change over time. Accepts the pre-defined values "`linear`", "`ease`", "`ease-in`", "`ease-out`", and "`ease-in-out`", or a custom "`cubic-bezier`" value like "`cubic-bezier(0.42, 0, 0.58, 1)`".

properties.name: endDelay
properties.description: The number of milliseconds to delay after the end of an animation. This is primarily of use when sequencing animations based on the end time of another animation.

properties.name: fill
properties.description: Dictates whether the animation's effects should be reflected by the element(s) prior to playing ("`backwards`"), retained after the animation has completed playing ("`forwards`"), or `both`.

properties.name: iterationComposite
properties.description: Determines how values build from iteration to iteration in this animation. Can be set to `accumulate` or `replace`.

properties.name: iterations
properties.description: The number of times the animation should repeat. And can also take a value of [Infinity](https://mdn.io/infinity) to make it repeat for as long as the element exists.

properties.name: iterationStart
properties.description: Describes at what point in the iteration the animation should start. 0.5 would indicate starting halfway through the first iteration for example, and with this value set, an animation with 2 iterations would end halfway through a third iteration.

properties.name: name
properties.description: Specifies what kind of animation will play. The list of available animations is [here](/element/animation/names).

elements.title: Animation
elements.description: Creates an animation and applies it to the content. Powered by the [Web Animations API](https://mdn.io/web-animations-api). A wide range of animations is available [here](https://www.htmlplus.io/element/animation/names).

methods.name: done
methods.description: Hides the progress bar. If true is passed, the bar briefly appears before hiding.

methods.name: increase
methods.description: Increments by a random amount.

methods.name: set
methods.description: Adjusts the progress of the bar, with the argument representing a value between `0` and `1`.

methods.name: start
methods.description: Shows the progress bar.

methods.name: trickle
methods.description: Increments the progress by a random amount based on the trickle rate.

properties.name: minimum
properties.description: Determines the minimum percentage used upon starting, which must be a value between `0.0` and `1.0`.

properties.name: trickleDisabled
properties.description: Turn off the automatic incrementing behavior by setting this to `true`.

properties.name: trickleRate
properties.description: The rate at which the progress bar increments when trickling.

properties.name: trickleSpeed
properties.description: Adjust how often to trickle/increment, in ms.

elements.title: App Progress Bar
elements.description: A progress bar that offers clear and intuitive visual feedback on the status of asynchronous operations.

properties.name: shape
properties.description: Specifies the shape of the element.

properties.name: size
properties.description: Specifies the size of the element.

styles.description: Used to adjust the color.
styles.name: --plus-avatar-color

styles.description: Used to adjust the size (width & height).
styles.name: --plus-avatar-size

elements.title: Avatar
elements.description: An image representing a user's profile picture.

properties.name: hoverable
properties.description: Specifies whether to prominent the avatar when the mouse is entered or not.

properties.name: stacked
properties.description: Specifies whether avatars should be displayed compressed or not.

properties.name: expanderText
properties.description: Specifies the label for the expander button.

properties.name: offset
properties.description: Specifies the position of the expander button. The expander button is displayed when the number of items reached the maximum limit.

properties.name: max
properties.description: Specifies the Maximum number of items that are allowed to be displayed.

elements.title: Breadcrumb
elements.description: Breadcrumb element is a navigation pattern that shows the actual path of the current page. It represents the route using links, which enables the user to easily navigate upwards through the hierarchy.

events.name: plusChange
events.description: Fires when file(s) are selected.

events.name: plusError
events.description: Fires when selected invalid file(s).

events.name: plusSuccess
events.description: Fires when file(s) are added successfully.

methods.name: browse
methods.description: Opens the browse dialog.

properties.name: accept
properties.description: One or more [unique file type specifiers](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/input/file#unique_file_type_specifiers) describing file types to allow.

properties.name: min
properties.description: Specifies the minimum number of files.

properties.name: max
properties.description: Specifies the maximum number of files.

properties.name: minSize
properties.description: Specifies the minimum size of the file(s) in bytes.

properties.name: maxSize
properties.description: Specifies the maximum size of the file(s) in bytes.

properties.name: multiple
properties.description: Allows to select more than one file.

elements.title: Browse
elements.description: Allows you to select file or files by using click or drag & drop functionality.

properties.name: elevation
properties.description: If you want the card to have shadow, use the elevation property, And select the property value between `1` and `24`.

properties.name: flat
properties.description: Use the flat property to neutralize elevation.

properties.name: outlined
properties.description: If you want the card to have border, use the outlined property.

properties.name: tile
properties.description: Use tile property to neutralize border-radius.

styles.description: Used to adjust the background-color.
styles.name: --plus-card-background-color

styles.description: Used to adjust the border-color.
styles.name: --plus-card-border-color

styles.description: Used to adjust the border-radius.
styles.name: --plus-card-border-radius

styles.description: Used to adjust the border-width.
styles.name: --plus-card-border-width

styles.description: Used to adjust the box-shodow.
styles.name: --plus-card-box-shadow

elements.title: Card
elements.description: Cards contain content and actions about a single subject.

events.name: plusDestroy
events.description: Runs when the carousel has been destroyed. This only fires once and will be the last event the carousel fires.

events.name: plusInit
events.description: Runs when the carousel mounts for the first time.

events.name: plusPointerDown
events.description: Runs when the user has a pointer down on the carousel. It's triggered by a `touchstart` or a `mousedown` event.

events.name: plusPointerUp
events.description: Runs when the user has released the pointer from the carousel. It's triggered by a `touchend` or a `mouseup` event.

events.name: plusReInit
events.description: TODO

events.name: plusResize
events.description: Runs when the carousel container or the slide sizes change. It's using [ResizeObserver](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/ResizeObserver) under the hood.

events.name: plusScroll
events.description: Runs when the carousel is scrolling. It might be a good idea to throttle this if you're doing expensive stuff in your callback function.

events.name: plusSelect
events.description: Runs when the selected scroll snap changes.

events.name: plusSettle
events.description: Runs when the carousel has settled after scroll has been triggered.

events.name: plusSlideFocus
events.description: Runs when a slide receives focus. For example, when a focusable element like a button, link or input receives focus inside a slide.

events.name: plusSlideFocusStart
events.description: TODO

events.name: plusSlidesChanged
events.description: Runs when slides are added to, or removed from the carousel **container**.

events.name: plusSlidesInView
events.description: Runs when any slide has **entered** or **exited** the viewport.

methods.name: canScrollNext
methods.description: Check the possibility to scroll to a next snap point. If **loop** property is enabled and the container holds any slides, this will always return `true`.

methods.name: canScrollPrevious
methods.description: Check the possiblity to scroll to a previous snap point. If **loop** property is enabled and the container holds any slides, this will always return `true`.

methods.name: previousScrollSnap
methods.description: Get the index of the previously selected snap point.

methods.name: scrollNext
methods.description: TODO: Resets automatic behavior in the carousel.
methods.Method: () reset() { // this.plugins.auto.reset(); } Scroll to the next snap point if possible. When **loop** property is disabled and the carousel has reached the last snap point, this method won't do anything. Set the **jump** parameter to `true` when you want to go to the next slide instantly.

methods.name: scrollPrevious
methods.description: Scroll to the previous snap point if possible. When **loop** property is disabled and the carousel has reached the first snap point, this method won't do anything. Set the **jump** parameter to `true` when you want to go to the previous slide instantly.

methods.name: scrollProgress
methods.description: Check how far the carousel has scrolled of its scrollable length from 0 - 1. For example, **0.5 equals 50%**. For example, this can be useful when creating a scroll progress bar.

methods.name: scrollSnapList
methods.description: Get an array containing all the snap point positions. Each position represents how far the carousel needs to progress in order to reach this position.

methods.name: scrollToIndex
methods.description: Scroll to a snap point by its unique index. If **loop** property is enabled, Embla Carousel will choose the closest way to the target snap point. Set the **jump** parameter to `true` when you want to go to the desired slide instantly.

methods.name: selectedScrollSnap
methods.description: Get the index of the selected snap point.

methods.name: slideNodes
methods.description: Get all the slide nodes inside the container. This method can be useful when you need to manipulate the slide elements dynamically or similar.

methods.name: slidesInView
methods.description: Get slide indexes **visible** in the carousel viewport. Honors the [inViewThreshold](https://www.embla-carousel.com/api/options/#inviewthreshold) option.

methods.name: slidesNotInView
methods.description: Get slide indexes **not visible** in the carousel viewport. Honors the [inViewThreshold](https://www.embla-carousel.com/api/options/#inviewthreshold) option.

properties.name: align
properties.description: Align the slides relative to the carousel viewport.

properties.name: autoHeight
properties.description: Enables the height of the carousel container to be adjusted to match the tallest slide in view. This element provides a built-in implementation of Embla's `Auto Height` plugin, so there's no need to include the original plugin manually.

properties.name: classes
properties.description: Enables automatic class injection for styling based on carousel state. This element provides a built-in implementation of Embla's `Class Names` plugin, so there's no need to include the original plugin manually.

properties.name: containScroll
properties.description: Clear leading and trailing empty space that causes excessive scrolling. Use `trimSnaps` to only use snap points that trigger scrolling or `keepSnaps` to keep them. **Note**: When this is active, it will **override alignments** applied by the **align** property for enough slides at the **start** and the **end** of the carousel, in order to **cover** the **leading** and **trailing space**.

properties.name: draggable
properties.description: Enables scrolling the carousel using mouse and touch interactions.

properties.name: dragThreshold
properties.description: Drag threshold in pixels. This only affects **when** clicks are fired and not. In contrast to other carousel libraries, it will **not affect when dragging** of the carousel **starts**. **Note**: Browsers handle touch events differently than mouse events. Browsers won't fire the click event when a touch event includes an accidental slight swipe gesture. This is why this threshold only works for mouse events.

properties.name: duration
properties.description: Set scroll duration when triggered by any of the API methods. Higher numbers enables slower scrolling. Drag interactions are not affected because duration is then determined by the drag force. **Note**: Duration is **not** in milliseconds because Embla uses an attraction physics simulation when scrolling instead of easings. Only values between `20-60` are recommended.

properties.name: focusable
properties.description: Enables automatic focus event watching on slides. When enabled, fires a slideFocus event and scrolls to the focused slide.

properties.name: inViewThreshold
properties.description: This is the Intersection Observer [threshold](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Intersection_Observer_API#creating_an_intersection_observer) option that will be applied to all slides.

properties.name: loop
properties.description: Enables infinite looping by translating slides to create a seamless loop. Automatically disables if slide content is insufficient to prevent glitches.

properties.name: plugins
properties.description: Pass Embla [plugins](https://www.embla-carousel.com/plugins) to extend carousel functionality.

properties.name: mirror
properties.description: Matches the current slide on another carousel using its id.

properties.name: mirrorType
properties.description: Specifies how the carousel should be mirrored onto another carousel.

properties.name: resizable
properties.description: Watches the **container** and **slides** for size changes and runs reInit when any size has changed.

properties.name: slidesToScroll
properties.description: Group slides together. Drag interactions, dot navigation, and previous/next buttons are mapped to group slides into the given number, which has to be an integer. Set it to `auto` if you want to group slides automatically.

properties.name: startIndex
properties.description: Set the initial scroll snap to the given number. First snap index starts at 0. Please note that this is not necessarily equal to the number of slides when used together with the `slidesToScroll` property.

properties.name: tweenFactorBase
properties.description: Sets the base multiplier for the `--plus-carousel-factor-*` CSS variables used in visual transitions. This allows you to create dynamic slide effects such as scaling or fading. For example, setting this value enables effects like: - [Scale](https://www.embla-carousel.com/examples/predefined/#scale) - [Opacity](https://www.embla-carousel.com/examples/predefined/#opacity) The value affects how strongly the visual transformation is applied relative to the slide's position in the carousel.

properties.name: variant
properties.description: Provides a visual style variant for the carousel. Can be used to conditionally apply CSS themes or variants.

properties.name: overrides
properties.description: TODO: Indicates whether the carousel has been successfully initialized.

elements.title: Carousel
elements.description: A carousel element for cycling through elementslike images or text slides.

properties.name: jump
properties.description: Determines whether the carousel instantly jumps to the target slide or transitions smoothly.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Specifies whether the button is 'previous', 'next', or a `number` for navigating to a specific slide.

properties.name: template
properties.description: A customizable template string for displaying the carousel's slide counter. This template supports two placeholders that will be dynamically replaced: - `%CURRENT%`: Represents the number of the currently active slide. - `%TOTAL%`: Represents the total number of slides in the carousel.

properties.name: clickable
properties.description: Controls what happens when you click an indicator. If `true`, it smoothly moves to the slide, and if set to `jump`, it instantly jumps without animation.

properties.name: infinity
properties.description: Allows indicators to wrap around the carousel when reaching the beginning or end.

properties.name: numbers
properties.description: Displays slide numbers inside the indicators.

properties.name: clickable
properties.description: Enables slide navigation when the slide is clicked. - If set to `true`, clicking the slide scrolls it smoothly to the nearest snap point. - If set to `'jump'`, clicking the slide instantly jumps to the snap point without animation. When the parent carousel has looping enabled, the slide will navigate via the shortest path to the target snap point.

properties.name: inline
properties.description: Converts the `display` CSS property from `flex` to `inline-flex`.

elements.title: Center
elements.description: Centers content vertically and horizontally.

events.name: plusClickOutside
events.description: Fires when outside of the element is clicked.

properties.name: capture
properties.description: A boolean value indicating that events of this type will be dispatched to the registered `listener` before being dispatched to any `EventTarget` beneath it in the DOM tree.

elements.title: Click Outside
elements.description: Detects when a click event happens outside of itself.

events.name: plusComplete
events.description: Is Triggered when transition ended.

methods.name: complete
methods.description: Completes the transition.

methods.name: pause
methods.description: Pauses the transition.

methods.name: start
methods.description: Starts the transition.

methods.name: stop
methods.description: Stops the transition.

properties.name: easing
properties.description: Easing function. Click [here](http://robertpenner.com/easing) for more details.

properties.name: delay
properties.description: Delay in milliseconds before starting the transition.

elements.title: Counter
elements.description: Can be used to quickly create animations that display numerical data in a more interesting way.

events.name: plusCrop
events.description: Fires when the `image` or the `viewport` is changed.

events.name: plusCropEnd
events.description: Fires when the `image` or the `viewport` changes are finished.

events.name: plusCropMove
events.description: Fires when the `image` or the `viewport` is changing.

events.name: plusCropStart
events.description: Fires when the `image` or the `viewport` starts to change.

events.name: plusReady
events.description: Fires when the image has been loaded and the element is ready for operation.

events.name: plusZoom
events.description: Fires when the element starts to `zoom in` or `zoom out`.

methods.name: flipX
methods.description: Flips horizontally.

methods.name: flipY
methods.description: Flips vertically.

methods.name: move

parameters.description: Moving size (px) in the `horizontal` direction. Use `null` to ignore this.
parameters.name: offsetX

parameters.description: Moving size (px) in the `vertical` direction. Use `null` to ignore this.
parameters.name: offsetY

methods.description: Moves the canvas with relative offsets.

methods.name: moveTo

parameters.description: The `left` value of the canvas. Use `null` to ignore this.
parameters.name: x

parameters.description: The `top` value of the canvas. Use `null` to ignore this.
parameters.name: y

methods.description: Moves the canvas to an absolute point.

methods.name: reset
methods.description: Resets the image and viewport to their initial states.

methods.name: rotate
methods.description: Rotates the image with a relative degree.

methods.name: rotateTo
methods.description: Rotates the image to an absolute degree.

methods.name: toCanvas
methods.description: Gets `canvas` from the cropped image.

methods.name: zoom
methods.description: Zooms the canvas with a relative ratio.

methods.name: zoomTo
methods.description: Zooms the canvas to an absolute ratio.

properties.name: area
properties.description: A number between 0 and 1. Specifies the automatic cropping area size.

properties.name: aspectRatio
properties.description: Specifies the initial aspect ratio of the viewport.

properties.name: background
properties.description: Shows the grid background of the container.

properties.name: guides
properties.description: Shows the dashed lines above the viewport.

properties.name: indicator
properties.description: Shows the center indicator above the viewport.

properties.name: resizer
properties.description: Enables to resize the viewport by dragging (Works when the value of the `mode` property is `crop`).

properties.name: resizerShape
properties.description: Specifies the shape of the resizer.

properties.name: shape
properties.description: Specifies the shape of the viewport.

properties.name: transparent
properties.description: Hides the black modal above the image and under the viewport.

properties.name: zoomRatio
properties.description: Specifies zoom ratio when zooming the image by wheeling the mouse.

elements.title: Cropper
elements.description: Used for cropping large images to fit a container before uploading them to the server.

events.name: plusClose
events.description: When the dialog is going to hide

events.name: plusClosed
events.description: When the dialog is completely closed and its animation is completed.

events.name: plusOpen
events.description: When the dialog is going to show this event triggers

events.name: plusOpened
events.description: When the dialog is completely shown and its animation is completed.

methods.name: hide
methods.description: Hides the element.

tags.value: {Promise<boolean>} A Promise that resolves to `true` if the operation was successful or `false` if it was canceled.

methods.name: show
methods.description: Shows the element.

tags.value: {Promise<boolean>} A Promise that resolves to `true` if the operation was successful or `false` if it was canceled.

methods.name: toggle
methods.description: Toggles between `collapse` and `expand` state.

tags.value: {Promise<boolean>} A Promise that resolves to `true` if the operation was successful or `false` if it was canceled.

properties.name: connector
properties.description: This property helps you to attach which dialog toggler controls the dialog. It doesn't matter where the dialog toggler is. You can put the dialog's toggler inside or outside of the dialog. Read more about connectors [here](/connector).

properties.name: fullHeight
properties.description: Set the height of the dialog as much as the screen's height.

properties.name: fullWidth
properties.description: Set the width of the dialog as much as the screen's width.

properties.name: fullscreen
properties.description: Set both width and height of the dialog to occupy the screen size.

properties.name: keyboard
properties.description: Closes the dialog when `escape` key is pressed.

properties.name: open
properties.description: Control dialog to show or not.

properties.name: persistent
properties.description: It prevents the dialog from closing on clicking outside of the element.

properties.name: placement
properties.description: Specifies where to show the dialog box by choosing two values, one for horizontal and another for vertical. Horizontal has a range of `left`, `center`, `right`, `start`, `end`, and vertical values are `top`, `center` and `bottom`.

properties.name: scrollable
properties.description: It makes the user able to scroll the content by adding a scroll beside it.

properties.name: size
properties.description: Determine the width of the dialog.

properties.name: sticky
properties.description: Removes the margin around the dialog's content.

properties.name: transparent
properties.description: Deactivate the dialog's backdrop to show or not.

elements.title: Dialog
elements.description: A dialog is a `conversation` between the system and the user. It is prompted when the system needs input from the user or to give the user urgent information concerning their current workflow.

properties.name: scrollable
properties.description: It makes the user able to scroll the content by adding a scroll beside it.

properties.name: scrollable
properties.description: It makes the user able to scroll the content by adding a scroll beside it.

properties.name: connector
properties.description: This property helps you to attach which dialog this toggler controls. It doesn't matter where the dialog toggler is. You can put the dialog's toggler inside or outside of the dialog. Read more about connectors [here](/connector).

slots.name: open
slots.description: Specifies the content of toggler when it's opened.

slots.name: close
slots.description: Specifies the content of toggler when it's closed.

properties.name: orientation
properties.description: Draws the divider in a `horizontal` or `vertical` orientation.

properties.name: placement
properties.description: Specifies the location of the default slot.

properties.name: size
properties.description: Specifies the thickness of the border.

properties.name: stroke
properties.description: Specifies the style of the border.

styles.description: Used to adjust the color.
styles.name: --plus-divider-color

styles.description: Used to adjust the thickness.
styles.name: --plus-divider-size

styles.description: Used to adjust the stroke.
styles.name: --plus-divider-stroke

elements.title: Divider
elements.description: A thin line that divides the content vertically or horizontally.

events.name: plusClose
events.description: When the drawer is going to hide

events.name: plusClosed
events.description: When the drawer is completely closed and its animation is completed.

events.name: plusOpen
events.description: When the drawer is going to show this event triggers

events.name: plusOpened

methods.name: hide

tags.value: {Promise<boolean>} A Promise that resolves to `true` if the operation was successful or `false` if it was canceled.

methods.name: show

tags.value: {Promise<boolean>} A Promise that resolves to `true` if the operation was successful or `false` if it was canceled.

methods.name: toggle
methods.description: Toggles between `collapse` and `expand` state.

tags.value: {Promise<boolean>} A Promise that resolves to `true` if the operation was successful or `false` if it was canceled.

properties.name: backdrop
properties.description: Activate the drawer's backdrop to show or not. It works when floating is activated.

properties.name: connector
properties.description: This property helps you to attach which drawer toggler controls the drawer. It doesn't matter where the drawer toggler is. You can put the drawer's toggler inside or outside of the drawer. Read more about connectors [here](/connector).

properties.name: floating
properties.description: On default the drawer is considered as a part of the main container. it pushes the other contents on opening. If true it will be opened over other contents and doesn't affect other contents. A floating drawer sits above its application and uses a backdrop to darken the background.

properties.name: mini
properties.description: Set the width of drawer to the minimum size you specified for the `mini-size` property.

properties.name: miniSize
properties.description: Sets the minimum width size of the drawer.

properties.name: open
properties.description: Control drawer to show or not.

properties.name: persistent
properties.description: If true, don't allow the drawer to be closed by clicking outside of the drawer. If false, the drawer will be closed by clicking outside of it.

properties.name: placement
properties.description: Specifies where the drawer will open.

properties.name: flexible
properties.description: It controls the flexibility of the drawer's width. If yes, the width of the drawer can be reduced. If false doesn't allow the width of the drawer to reduce.

properties.name: size
properties.description: Determine the width of the drawer.

elements.title: Drawer
elements.description: This element lets you add collapsible side contents like navigation alongside some primary content.

properties.name: connector
properties.description: This property helps you to attach which drawer this toggler controls. It doesn't matter where the drawer toggler is. You can put the drawer's toggler inside or outside of the drawer. Read more about connectors [here](/connector).

slots.name: open
slots.description: Specifies the content of toggler when it's opened.

slots.name: close
slots.description: Specifies the content of toggler when it's closed.

properties.name: arguments
properties.description: Specifies the API's arguments as an array.

elements.title: Faker
elements.description: Generates massive amounts of fake (but realistic) data for testing and development. Powered by [Faker](https://fakerjs.dev/).

properties.name: display
properties.description: Specifies the unit will be shown as an abbreviation or not.

properties.name: decimals
properties.description: Specifies the number of decimal places. Use an array to specify the minimum and maximum.

properties.name: separator
properties.description: Specifies the separator between number and unit.

properties.name: signed
properties.description: Shows plus sign for positive numbers. If the difference is exactly zero a space character will be prepended instead for better alignment.

properties.name: standard
properties.description: Specifies the standard of units. [Metric and IEC](https://wikipedia.org/wiki/Gigabyte) are supported.

properties.name: unit
properties.description: Specifies the unit in which the result will be returned.

elements.title: Format Bytes
elements.description: Converts bytes to a human-readable string. [Metric and IEC](https://wikipedia.org/wiki/Gigabyte) standard are supported.

properties.name: label
properties.description: Specifies an alternate description to use for assistive devices.

properties.name: resolver
properties.description: An asynchronous function to load SVG files.

elements.title: Icon
elements.description: A graphical representation of an action, object, or idea that is used in a user interface to provide visual cues and improve the user experience. All icons are based on the popular [Bootstrap Icons](https://icons.getbootstrap.com) library.

events.name: plusChange
events.description: Fires When the browser detects that the element has been unveiled or obscured.

properties.name: root
properties.description: The element that is used as the viewport for checking visibility of the target. Must be the ancestor of the target. Defaults to the browser viewport if not specified or if `null`.

properties.name: rootMargin
properties.description: Margin around the root. Can have values similar to the CSS [margin](https://mdn.io/margin) property, e.g. `"10px 20px 30px 40px"` (top, right, bottom, left). The values can be percentages. This set of values serves to grow or shrink each side of the root element's bounding box before computing intersections. Defaults to all zeros.

properties.name: threshold
properties.description: Either a single number or an array of numbers which indicate at what percentage of the target's visibility the observer's callback should be executed. If you only want to detect when visibility passes the 50% mark, you can use a value of 0.5. If you want the callback to run every time visibility passes another 25%, you would specify the array [0, 0.25, 0.5, 0.75, 1]. The default is 0 (meaning as soon as even one pixel is visible, the callback will be run). A value of 1.0 means that the threshold isn't considered passed until every pixel is visible.

elements.title: Intersection
elements.description: The [Intersection Observer API](https://mdn.io/intersection-observer-api) provides a way to asynchronously observe changes in the intersection of a target element with an ancestor element or with a top-level document's [viewport](https://mdn.io/glossary-viewport).

properties.name: theme
properties.description: The theme to apply for syntax highlighting.

properties.name: sync
properties.description: Whether to synchronize updates with DOM changes.

properties.name: resolver
properties.description: A custom resolver function to load Prism assets (e.g., languages, themes, plugins).

elements.title: Prism
elements.description: Syntax highlighting for code snippets, supporting multiple programming languages and offering customizable themes. Powered by [PrismJS](https://prismjs.com/).

properties.name: buffer
properties.description: Specifies the secondary progress of the bar by a number between `min` and `max`.

properties.name: color
properties.description: Specifies the color of the bar.

properties.name: min
properties.description: Specifies the minimum value of the progress.

properties.name: max
properties.description: Specifies the maximum value of the progress.

properties.name: value
properties.description: Specifies the progress of the bar by a number between `min` and `max`.

styles.description: Specifies the color of the bar.
styles.name: --plus-progress-bar-indicator-background-color

elements.title: Progress Bar
elements.description: Progress bar expresses an unspecified wait time or display the length of a process.

properties.name: format
properties.description: The format style for the relative time.

properties.name: numeric
properties.description: Determines whether the numeric value should always be displayed.

properties.name: sync
properties.description: Determines whether the relative time should be updated automatically.

properties.name: value
properties.description: The date and time to be displayed in a relative format.

elements.title: Relative Time
elements.description: Outputs a localized time phrase relative to the provided datetime.

events.name: plusChange
events.description: Fires when the scroll starts changing.

properties.name: reference

properties.name: vertical
properties.description: Indicates which scroll (horizontal or vertical) is to be used as the source.

elements.title: Scroll Detector
elements.description: Detects scroll event from an element.

events.name: plusChange
events.description: Fires after the latest changes have occurred with a delay to prepare the value.

events.name: plusBefore

events.name: plusEnd

events.name: plusStart
events.description: Fires before a stroke starts.

methods.name: redo
methods.description: Reverts the last undo action.

methods.name: resize
methods.description: Syncs the canvas dimensions with the element dimensions.

methods.name: undo
methods.description: Reverts the last action.

properties.name: color
properties.description: Specifies the color of the strokes.

properties.name: distance
properties.description: Specifies the distance between the previous point and the next one.

properties.name: dotSize
properties.description: Specifies the radius of a single dot.

properties.name: maxWidth
properties.description: Specifies the maximum width of the strokes.

properties.name: minWidth
properties.description: Specifies the minimum width of the strokes.

properties.name: resizable
properties.description: Observes the element dimensions to apply new changes on the canvas.

properties.name: throttle
properties.description: Specifies the time distance between the previous point and the next one.

properties.name: velocity
properties.description: Specifies the velocity based on the previous velocity.

properties.name: redoable
properties.description: Specifies whether redo can be performed or not.

properties.name: undoable
properties.description: Specifies whether undo can be performed or not.

elements.title: Signature
elements.description: Allows user to draw smooth signatures.

styles.description: Used to adjust the color.

elements.title: Snippet
elements.description: A component that can be used to display inline code snippets.

properties.name: type

properties.name: items
properties.description: The alignment of items along the cross axis.

properties.description: The distribution of items along the main axis.

properties.name: reverse

properties.name: wrap
properties.description: Controls whether items should wrap onto multiple lines.

elements.title: Stack
elements.description: A container for arranging elements vertically or horizontally.

events.name: plusChange
events.description: Fires when the state is changed. To enable, set the `watcher` property to `true`.

properties.name: watcher
properties.description: To active `state` attribute, `change` event, `normal` slot, or `stick` slot, Set it to `true`.

elements.title: Sticky
elements.description: Element content is positioned based on the user's scroll position.

slots.name: normal
slots.description: Activated when the state becomes `normal`. To enable, set the `watcher` property to `true`.

slots.name: stick
slots.description: Activated when the state becomes `stick`. To enable, set the `watcher` property to `true`.

events.name: plusChange

elements.title: Switch

properties.description: Specifies a delay in milliseconds for show or hide. Use a number for both show and hide or create an array of two separate numbers for show and hide.

properties.description: Specifies the display location of the element relative to the reference.

properties.name: reference
properties.description: Specifies the element to which the tooltip will be attached. Use `next` to attach to the next sibling. Use `parent` to attach to the parent. Use `previous` to attach to the previous sibling. Use a string to find an element to attach to that. Use an element to attach to that.
